column4: timido, I just don't know if I have to open port 23 as tcp, udp or both!
I don't have one, but I use a router
sorry if this seems a stupid question, but how can I try it?
After you check that it works by IP, the easiest way of making sure you can get in externally, is by running a 'dyndns' client on your computer. That way you get a hostname to ssh to.
Now go to www.dyndns.org, set up a hostname, install a dyndns client and configure that.
You need to set the interface to 'web' in the ddclient config file.
Coz at the moment it's using the IP 10.0.0.1
, where can I find that config file?
, now what like exactly do I need to change? ----> http://paste.ubuntulinux.nl/2956
